content: So bummed this doesn't have local network/ LAN multiplayer mode like regular ticket to ride does. Pass and play just doesn't cut it for our family. Otherwise a great gateway game to introduce young players to elements of better board games.
Seems to work fine
This is a poorly made game,i installed it to try and understand the whole game of Ticket to Ride, i played many games and still have no clue... poorly made
Simplified maps suitable for younger players - note at 4 players later game choices can be quite limited. AI seems fair. Nicely animated. Building routes near bottom edge of screen can be fiddly.

What why do you think this game that can stand it's totally hot and I'm not üíØI give you 100 and a crying bone and 1/8 an Italian 9 9 9 9 9 9 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 and it's not ABCD EFG HIJK LMNOP QRS TUV WX y&z now I know my ABC's next time won't you sing with me it's agent I am hated him
It's fun but the animations are maddening
Looks great, plays great: lack of online play makes it pretty pointless. Have gone back to full Ticket to Ride because all family members have it on their devices and you can play online.
Pretty fun but repetitive. Great with friends
Me mad my 5 year old love this. It is really streamlined from the full game and perfect for the kids.
Got it to teach mechanics of game and hopefully get the nephew to move onto vanilla versions play with grownups.
Kids game that's fun and challenging enough for adults. Cute and creative graphics
Run at startup permission equates to data mining. You can't refuse the permission. No thanks.

The AI is set to be way too difficult. On the easy difficulty my kids can NEVER win. On the easy difficulty I can only win 1 in 5 times. For a game aimed at kids it should be basically impossible to lose to an easy AI. Developer should adjust this asap.
Please add support for Google Play Games (achievements, leader boards, cloud saves, etc). Thanks.
It's pretty slow. Wish I could skip the animations by tapping anywhere.
Terrible controls. Boring.
Tutorial didn't make much sense, tried playing the first game but had no idea what was going on.

The animations are incredibly slow. I wanted to play more but couldn't finish the second game. After seeing the city characters bounce and whistle for the 50th time I was going crazy. If you finish a route and east to west you might be watching 10-15 of them in sequence. Not just for yourself but when AI players do things too, even just switching player or placing trains is slow. Can't imagine playing 4 players. We'd be handing the phone around too because there's no online multiplayer mode.
4 year old loves it! Easy game play and fun!
Great game for kids
Nice, fun, quick games and above all, improves thinking logic for kids. Even bought an actual board game after playing this. Super good üëç

A good intro to basics of ticket to ride. With bots at medium or higher difficulty it does make it challenging. I felt that 3 players was optimum. With 4 players I felt the game left you with too few choices too quickly. Still, I think it is a very good game and not just for kids. Good on 5 inch screen. Works on Motorola Z3. Great for quick play while waiting for an appointment. You also get the Europe map free if you sign in with an Asmodee account.
this game really should have an undo option for the most recent action. way too easy to put locomotives on the wrong tracks
Simple but fun game. The tutorial could've been a bit better. Also the animations make the gameplay slow. But overall I like playing it often.
It does not let me and 3 computer men or 3 of my mates to teach them how to play if they are slow learners.

content: Great simplified version of a great game. It may be easier to pick up the rules but it still offerers enough of a challenge for kids and adults alike. Not got time for a full game of Ticket to Ride, then play this instead!

content: It says educational, but I never came across anything educational.  It is how every a great introduction into the Ticket To Ride series.  This will be good to get kids to learn before bumping them up to the real version.  Adults should skip this and go straight to the original version for a better game.  Get this, if you want to play with a younger crowd OR to have a quicker game play while you're on lunch or just chilling.
Love it!  Just be sure to go into app settings and enable storage on Android 8
